intro: Tuberaria variabilis f. diformis, commonly known as the variable tuberaria, is a botanical variant of the species Tuberaria variabilis. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Capparaceae, characterized by its distinctive floral structures. The plant exhibits morphological variability, particularly in its flower morphology, which contributes to its classification as a form. It typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils and is found in Mediterranean regions. Its unique features make it a subject of interest in botanical studies and horticultural cultivation.
